Massive MIMO is a key technology for next generation wireless networks since high data rate can be achieved when large antenna arrays are adoptedÂ [32]. Hence, we consider an FL based wireless communication system that consists of a BS equipped with a massive MIMO system of Nğ‘N antennas serving Kğ¾K arbitrarily distributed single-antenna users with Nâ‰«Kmuch-greater-thanğ‘ğ¾N\gg K as shown in Fig.Â 1. A given time interval is partitioned into Lğ¿L frames with duration Toutsubscriptğ‘‡outT_{\textrm{out}}. Each user kğ‘˜k has its dataset ğ’Ÿk={ğ‘¿k,ğ’šk}subscriptğ’Ÿğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¿ğ‘˜subscriptğ’šğ‘˜\mathcal{D}_{k}=\{\bm{X}_{k},\bm{y}_{k}\}, where ğ‘¿k=[ğ’™k,1,ğ’™k,2,â€¦,ğ’™k,Mk]subscriptğ‘¿ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™ğ‘˜1subscriptğ’™ğ‘˜2â€¦subscriptğ’™ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘€ğ‘˜\bm{X}_{k}=[\bm{x}_{k,1},\bm{x}_{k,2},\ldots,\bm{x}_{k,M_{k}}], and ğ’šk=[yk,1,yk,2,â€¦,yk,Mk]subscriptğ’šğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¦ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘¦ğ‘˜2â€¦subscriptğ‘¦ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘€ğ‘˜\bm{y}_{k}=[y_{k,1},y_{k,2},\ldots,y_{k,M_{k}}] represent the input and output of user kğ‘˜k, Mksubscriptğ‘€ğ‘˜M_{k} represents the number of the samples collected by user kğ‘˜k. Let M=âˆ‘k=1KMkğ‘€superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ¾subscriptğ‘€ğ‘˜M=\sum_{k=1}^{K}M_{k} be the total number of training data samples and ğ’˜kâ€‹(i)subscriptğ’˜ğ‘˜ğ‘–\bm{w}_{k}(i) be the weight vector of the local FL model of user kğ‘˜k at frame iğ‘–i. The BS aims to fit the weight vector of the local FL model so as to minimize a particular loss function by using the whole dataset from all the available users. references: In this section, the performance of the FL over a wireless system powered by energy harvesting is evaluated through experimental simulations. The users are assumed to be randomly distributed within a circular cell. Two scenarios are investigated for the simulations, single BS (scenario 1) and multiple BSs (scenario 2). The simulation parameters used in this section are summarized in TableÂ II.
